instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3208: What is 820-3208? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R6905: What is R6905? Resistor between charger voltage and input to PP3V42_G3H power supply on older Macbooks, pre-2011 models. This resistor blows when C6990 has shorted to ground or U6990 has shorted to ground, and will result in PP3V42_G3H missing and the magsafe charger not having a light since PP3V42_G3H is necessary for the SMC to turn on and the onewire circuit to turn on..
definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no green light
threads.message:
Hi Guys, I have a Mac Air 11" 3208 with no green/red light. Checked power and no G3H and 3.42 as well. On <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> I get 20.55v on <CAPACITOR>C6912</CAPACITOR> pin 1. I have checked the resistors as well and get some different readings then what my schematics say. Now I have seen many istances where the schematics have wrong data, could you have a look at the readings I got and let me know if this is OK, <RESISTOR>R6911</RESISTOR> and 6912 seem a bit off. Thanks!

Edit: I just figured <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> has a hole in it, so will try replacing that first :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no green light
threads.message: OK so replaced the <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> but no luck yet. On <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> pin 2 i have 20.55v, this does not appear on <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> pin 2. The line is intact thats kinda weird? I would assume it must have 20.55v as well. So no power reaches <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> VIN (pin 6), any suggestions?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3208</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with no green light
threads.message: First off <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> burned for a reason. Is there a short on pin 3 of <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> or a short on 3V42? Trace from <RESISTOR>R6905</RESISTOR> to <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> could be burned or bad soldering. <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> may be dead too
